segment.source: Request a maps authentication key
segment.target: Request a maps authentication key

segment.source: Your Universal Windows app must be authenticated before it can use the MapControl and map services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.
segment.target: Your Universal Windows app must be authenticated before it can use the MapControl and map services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.

segment.source: Request a maps authentication key
segment.target: Request a maps authentication key

segment.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive \]

segment.source: Your Universal Windows app must be authenticated before it can use the MapControl and map services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.
segment.target: Your Universal Windows app must be authenticated before it can use the MapControl and map services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace.

segment.source: To authenticate your app, you must specify a maps authentication key.
segment.target: To authenticate your app, you must specify a maps authentication key.

segment.source: This topic describes how to request a maps authentication key from the Bing Maps Developer Center and add it to your app.
segment.target: This topic describes how to request a maps authentication key from the Bing Maps Developer Center and add it to your app.

segment.source: Tip To learn more about using maps in your app, download the following sample from the Windows-universal-samples repo on GitHub:
segment.target: Tip To learn more about using maps in your app, download the following sample from the Windows-universal-samples repo on GitHub:

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample

segment.source: Get a key
segment.target: Get a key

segment.source: Create and manage map authentication keys for your Universal Windows apps using the Bing Maps Developer Center.
segment.target: Create and manage map authentication keys for your Universal Windows apps using the Bing Maps Developer Center.

segment.source: To create a new key
segment.target: To create a new key

segment.source: In your browser, navigate to the Bing Maps Developer Center (https://www.bingmapsportal.com).
segment.target: In your browser, navigate to the Bing Maps Developer Center (https://www.bingmapsportal.com).

segment.source: If you are asked to sign in, enter your Microsoft account and click Sign in.
segment.target: If you are asked to sign in, enter your Microsoft account and click Sign in.

segment.source: Choose the account to associate with your Bing Maps account.
segment.target: Choose the account to associate with your Bing Maps account.

segment.source: If you want to use your Microsoft account, click Yes.
segment.target: If you want to use your Microsoft account, click Yes.

segment.source: Otherwise, click Sign in with another account.
segment.target: Otherwise, click Sign in with another account.

segment.source: If you don't already have a Bing Maps account, create a new Bing Maps account.
segment.target: If you don't already have a Bing Maps account, create a new Bing Maps account.

segment.source: Enter the Account Name, Contact Name, Company Name, Email Address, and Phone Number.
segment.target: Enter the Account Name, Contact Name, Company Name, Email Address, and Phone Number.

segment.source: After accepting the terms of use, click Create.
segment.target: After accepting the terms of use, click Create.

segment.source: Under the My account menu, click Create or view keys.
segment.target: Under the My account menu, click Create or view keys.

segment.source: Click on the link to create a new key.
segment.target: Click on the link to create a new key.

segment.source: Complete the Create Key form and then click Create.
segment.target: Complete the Create Key form and then click Create.

segment.source: Application name: The name of your application.
segment.target: Application name: The name of your application.

segment.source: Application URL (optional): The URL of your application.
segment.target: Application URL (optional): The URL of your application.

segment.source: Key type: Select Basic or Enterprise.
segment.target: Key type: Select Basic or Enterprise.

segment.source: Application type: Select Universal Windows App for use in your Universal Windows app.
segment.target: Application type: Select Universal Windows App for use in your Universal Windows app.

segment.source: This is an example of what the form looks like.
segment.target: This is an example of what the form looks like.

segment.source: an example of the create key form.
segment.target: an example of the create key form.

segment.source: After you click Create, the new key appears below the Create Key form.
segment.target: After you click Create, the new key appears below the Create Key form.

segment.source: Copy it to a safe place or immediately add it to your app, as described in the next step.
segment.target: Copy it to a safe place or immediately add it to your app, as described in the next step.

segment.source: Add the key to your app
segment.target: Add the key to your app

segment.source: The map authentication key is required to use the MapControl and map services (Windows.Services.Maps) in your Universal Windows app.
segment.target: The map authentication key is required to use the MapControl and map services (Windows.Services.Maps) in your Universal Windows app.

segment.source: Add it to the map control and map service objects, as applicable.
segment.target: Add it to the map control and map service objects, as applicable.

segment.source: To add the key to a map control
segment.target: To add the key to a map control

segment.source: To authenticate the MapControl, set the MapServiceToken property to the authentication key value.
segment.target: To authenticate the MapControl, set the MapServiceToken property to the authentication key value.

segment.source: You can set this property in code or in XAML markup, depending on your preferences.
segment.target: You can set this property in code or in XAML markup, depending on your preferences.

segment.source: For more info about using the MapControl, see Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views.
segment.target: For more info about using the MapControl, see Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views.

segment.source: This example sets the MapServiceToken to the value of the authentication key in code.
segment.target: This example sets the MapServiceToken to the value of the authentication key in code.

segment.source: This example sets the MapServiceToken to the value of the authentication key in XAML markup.
segment.target: This example sets the MapServiceToken to the value of the authentication key in XAML markup.

segment.source: To add the key to map services
segment.target: To add the key to map services

segment.source: To use services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace, set the ServiceToken property to the authentication key value.
segment.target: To use services in the Windows.Services.Maps namespace, set the ServiceToken property to the authentication key value.

segment.source: For more info about using map services, see Display routes and directions and Perform geocoding and reverse geocoding.
segment.target: For more info about using map services, see Display routes and directions and Perform geocoding and reverse geocoding.

segment.source: This example sets the ServiceToken to the value of the authentication key in code.
segment.target: This example sets the ServiceToken to the value of the authentication key in code.
